alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 28 at 6:08AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center. The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH for the following areas: NWS Las Vegas NV - CA-519 (Eastern Sierra in Inyo County) NWS Reno NV - CA-073 (Eastern Sierra in Mono County) * WHAT...The avalanche danger is expected to rise to HIGH at all elevations by 7 AM Wednesday March 29th. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virginia Lakes to the north to Bishop Creek to the south. * WHEN...In effect from Tuesday 7 AM PDT to Wednesday 7 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Periods of very heavy snowfall and strong winds will create sensitive wind slabs and stress a weak upper snowpack. Travel will be difficult. Expect widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions will develop overnight. Travel in avalanche terrain will not be recommended. Avalanches may break widely and run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
